segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
13. Gilānavagga
124. Dutiyaupaṭṭhākasutta
“Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato gilānupaṭṭhāko nālaṃ gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a carer with five qualities is not competent to care for a patient.

segments.pli: Katamehi pañcahi?
Nappaṭibalo hoti bhesajjaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ;
sappāyāsappāyaṃ na jānāti, asappāyaṃ upanāmeti, sappāyaṃ apanāmeti;
segments.en: They don’t know what is suitable and unsuitable, so they supply what is unsuitable and remove what is suitable.

segments.pli: āmisantaro gilānaṃ upaṭṭhāti, no mettacitto;
segments.en: They care for the sick for the sake of material benefits, not out of love.

segments.pli: jegucchī hoti uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā vantaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā nīharituṃ;
segments.en: They’re disgusted to remove feces, urine, vomit, or spit.

segments.pli: nappaṭibalo hoti gilānaṃ kālena kālaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetuṃ samādapetuṃ samuttejetuṃ sampahaṃsetuṃ.
segments.en: They’re unable to educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire the patient with a Dhamma talk from time to time.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato gilānupaṭṭhāko nālaṃ gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ.
segments.en: A carer with these five qualities is not competent to care for a patient.

segments.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato gilānupaṭṭhāko alaṃ gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ.
segments.en: A carer with five qualities is competent to care for a patient.

segments.pli: Katamehi pañcahi?
Paṭibalo hoti bhesajjaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ;
sappāyāsappāyaṃ jānāti, asappāyaṃ apanāmeti, sappāyaṃ upanāmeti;
segments.en: They know what is suitable and unsuitable, so they remove what is unsuitable and supply what is suitable.

segments.pli: mettacitto gilānaṃ upaṭṭhāti, no āmisantaro;
segments.en: They care for the sick out of love, not for the sake of material benefits.

segments.pli: ajegucchī hoti uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā vantaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā nīharituṃ;
segments.en: They’re not disgusted to remove feces, urine, vomit, or spit.

segments.pli: paṭibalo hoti gilānaṃ kālena kālaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetuṃ samādapetuṃ samuttejetuṃ sampahaṃsetuṃ.
segments.en: They’re able to educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire the patient with a Dhamma talk from time to time.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato gilānupaṭṭhāko alaṃ gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātun”ti.
segments.en: A carer with these five qualities is competent to care for a patient.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.
